definitions.definition: very small; much smaller than usual

examples.text: a rare breed of miniature horses
It looks like a miniature version of James Bond's car.
They expect their children to behave like miniature adults.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: from Italian miniatura, via medieval Latin from Latin miniare ‘illuminate’, from minium ‘red lead, vermilion’ (used to mark particular words in manuscripts).
